intro: Phacelia orogenes, commonly known as the Sierra phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue or purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky soils at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Phacelia orogenes plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
